greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) = gcd(n, A003961(n)), where A003961 is completely multiplicative with a(prime(k)) = prime(k+1).
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..20000
mathematica: a[n_] := If[n == 1, 1, GCD[n, Times@@(NextPrime[First[#]]^Last[#] &/@FactorInteger[n])]]; Array[a, 100] (* _Amiram Eldar_, Dec 05 2018~ *)
program: A003961(n) = my(f = factor(n)); for (i=1, #f~, f[i, 1] = nextprime(f[i, 1]+1)); factorback(f); \\ From A003961
results.author: _Antti Karttunen_, Dec 05 2018
